Business_rules BR001/BR002 cover child/root error tolerance but cite unshown root logic (21920,22192); child verified.
calling_context lists IO-PCB-MASK in linkage_section, but AST ENTRY uses only PAUTBPCB (01225033); confirm PDIV USING.

challenger_questions.question: Paragraph '9999-EXIT' exists in the source code (per static analysis) but is not documented in the template for cbl/PAUDBLOD.CBL. Please add documentation for this paragraph.
Paragraph 'PAUDBLOD' exists in the source code (per static analysis) but is not documented in the template for cbl/PAUDBLOD.CBL. Please add documentation for this paragraph.

issues_found: data_flow.writes_to incorrectly implies persistent IMS updates to summary counters at line 360 (in-memory only).
paragraphs section incomplete: key PERFORM targets (1000/5000/6000/9000) undocumented despite central role.
incoming_calls for 4000-CHECK-IF-EXPIRED lists line 136 (likely 1000-INITIALIZE, unrelated) vs. AST PERFORM at ~147.
dead_code flags linkage masks as unused, conflicting with PCB usage in DLI calls and linkage_section mention.
open_questions notes WS-ERR-FLG unused, but MAIN-PARA loop condition relies on it without visible sets.

challenger_questions.question: Paragraph 'CBPAUP0C' exists in the source code (per static analysis) but is not documented in the template for cbl/CBPAUP0C.cbl. Please add documentation for this paragraph.
Paragraph '9999-EXIT' exists in the source code (per static analysis) but is not documented in the template for cbl/CBPAUP0C.cbl. Please add documentation for this paragraph.

In data_flow.writes_to for PENDING-AUTH-SUMMARY, citation 360 refers to in-memory SUBTRACT operations in 4000-CHECK-IF-EXPIRED, but there is no DLI REPL, ISRT, or other IMS call to persist changes to the summary segment in the database. Does this accurately represent a database write, or should it be clarified as in-memory only for deletion decision?

metadata.issue_description: Multiple unresolved conflicts regarding READ vs WRITE access to DBPAUTP0. This likely stems from the JCL defining the database data sets for an IMS utility.

quality_notes.description: The call graph is highly detailed, showing complex interactions between online (CICS/BMS) and batch/IMS components.
Copybook usage is consistent across the authorization module (CIPAUDTY and CIPAUSMY are used by almost all PAU* programs).
Confidence levels are consistently MEDIUM, which is acceptable for a first-pass holistic review of a legacy mainframe system.
The relationship between JCL (LOADPADB, UNLDPADB) and COBOL (PAUDBLOD, PAUDBUNL) is clearly established.

jcl/DBPAUTP0.jcl: Multiple unresolved conflicts regarding READ vs WRITE access to DBPAUTP0. This likely stems from the JCL defining the database data sets for an IMS utility.
